attributes.action: recognise that there is majority support for an English Parliament
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The British government, in its responses to petitions and questions on the subject of creating an English Parliament, persists in claiming that there is little support for one.

The unelected Lord Chancellor (a Scottish Lord) has, on more than one occassion, referred to a government-commissioned poll that is several years old as "proof" that there is little support for an English Parliament.

Recent independent polls have shown consistent and increasing support for the establishment of an English Parliament.  The British government must recognise that their own poll is out-of-date and inaccurate and that an English Parliament is the settled will of the English people.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
